thag6.7:1.2: Don’t sleep too much, be wakeful.
thag6.7:1.3: Don’t be lazy and let the kinsman of the negligent,
thag6.7:1.4: the King of Death, catch you in his trap.
thag6.7:2.1: Like a wave in the mighty ocean,
thag6.7:2.2: rebirth and old age sweep you under.
thag6.7:2.3: Make a safe island of yourself,
thag6.7:2.4: for you have no other shelter.
thag6.7:3.1: The teacher has mastered this path,
thag6.7:3.2: which transcends chains, <j>and the fear of birth and old age.
thag6.7:3.3: Be diligent in the first and final watches of the night,
thag6.7:4.1: Free yourself from your former bonds!
thag6.7:4.2: Wearing your outer robe, with shaven head, <j>eating almsfood,
thag6.7:4.3: don’t delight in play or sleep,
thag6.7:5.2: you’re an expert in the path <j>to sanctuary  from the yoke.
thag6.7:5.4: you’ll be extinguished as a flame by water.
thag6.7:6.2: is bent down by the wind, like a creeper;
